008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.hough;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.HessianLine;
016
017/**
018 * This class represents a straight line of the form
019 * (x - xRef) * cos(angle) + (y - yRef) * sin(angle) = radius.
020 * It is used by the Hough transform (see {@link imagingbook.common.hough.HoughTransformLines}).
021 * It inherits from {@link HessianLine} which is, in turn, a subclass of 
022 * {@link AlgebraicLine}.
023 * It adds an arbitrary reference point (xRef, yRef) and a counter (count) for pixel votes.
024 * Instances are immutable.
025 */
026public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine> {
027        
028        private final double xRef, yRef;        // reference point
029        private final int count;                        // pixel votes for this line
030        
031        // static factory methods -------------------------------
032        
033        public static HoughLine from(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d pRef, int count) {
034                return new HoughLine(AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2), pRef.getX(), pRef.getY(), count);
035        }
036        
037        // constructors -----------------------------------------
038
039        /**
040         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from the
041         * specified {@link HessianLine} parameters (angle, radius),
042         * an arbitrary reference point (xRef, yRef) and count.
043         * 
044         * @param angle the line's normal angle (see {@link HessianLine})
045         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
046         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
047         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
048         * @param count pixel votes for this line
049         */
050        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
051                super(angle, radius);
052                this.xRef = xRef;
053                this.yRef = yRef;
054                this.count = count;
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Constructor. 
059         * Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
060         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance.
061         * The line parameters are adjusted to the specified reference point
062         * (actually only parameter c is modified, since a change of reference point
063         * effects only a shift of the line).
064         * The two lines are equivalent, i.e., contain the same points (x,y).
065         * Thus the distance from a given point (x,y) is the same from the original
066         * line and the new line.
067         * @param line an existing line ({@link AlgebraicLine} or subclass)
068         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
069         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
070         * @param count pixel votes for this line
071         */
072        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
073                super(new AlgebraicLine(line.A, line.B, line.C + line.A * (xRef - line.getXref()) + line.B * (yRef - line.getYref())));
074                this.xRef = xRef;
075                this.yRef = yRef;
076                this.count = count;
077        }
078        
079        /**
080         * Convenience constructor. Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
081         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance with the same reference point 
082         * as the original line and zero count.
083         * 
084         * @param line a {@link AlgebraicLine} instance
085         */
086        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line) {
087                this(line, line.getXref(), line.getYref(), 0);
088        }
089        
090        // ------------------------------------------
091        
092        @Override
093        public double getXref() {
094                return xRef;
095        }
096        
097        @Override
098        public double getYref() {
099                return yRef;
100        }
101        
102        public int getCount() {
103                return count;
104        }
105        
106        // other methods ------------------------------------------
107        
108        /**
109         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
110         * point count (in descending order, i.e., strong lines come first).
111         * @param other another {@link HoughLine} instance.
112         */
113        @Override
114        public int compareTo(HoughLine other) {
115                return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
116        }
117        
118        @Override
119        public String toString() {
120                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
121                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
122        }
123        
124}
